text: Stop drinking only water, and use a little wine.
text_zh: 因你的胃口不清，屢次患病，不要只喝水，要稍微喝點酒。

text: Wine makes life merry, and money is the answer for everything.
text_zh: 設擺筵席是為喜笑，酒能使人快活，錢能叫萬事應心。

text: Drink your wine with a merry heart.
text_zh: 歡歡喜喜喝你的酒。

text: I have drunk my wine with my milk.
text_zh: 我喝了我的酒和奶。

text: Do not gaze at wine when it is red, when it sparkles in the cup.
text_zh: 酒發紅，在杯中閃爍，順暢下嚥，你不可觀看。

text: Wine is a mocker and beer a brawler.
text_zh: 酒能使人褻慢，濃酒使人喧嚷

text: Stolen water is sweet; food eaten in secret is delicious!
text_zh: 偷來的水是甜的，暗處吃的餅是好的。

text: Do not wear clothing woven of two kinds of material.
text_zh: 不可用兩樣攙雜的料做衣服穿在身上。

text: You shall not round off the hair on your temples or mar the edges of your beard.
text_zh: 頭的周圍不可剃，鬍鬚的周圍也不可損壞。

text: If a man's hair falls out from his head, he is bald; he is clean.
text_zh: 人頭上的髮若掉了，他不過是頭禿；他是潔淨的。

text: Do not boil a young goat in its mother's milk.
text_zh: 不可用山羊羔母的奶煮山羊羔。

text: Dead flies make the perfumer's ointment give off a stench.
text_zh: 死蒼蠅使做香的膏油發出臭氣。

text: Like one who grabs a stray dog by the ears is someone who rushes into a quarrel not their own.
text_zh: 過路被事激動，管理不干己的爭競，好像人揪住狗耳。

text: All the days of his vow of separation no razor shall come upon his head.
text_zh: 在他一切許願離俗的日子，不可用剃頭刀剃頭。

text: Get out of here, baldy!
text_zh: 禿頭的上去吧！禿頭的上去吧！

text: If only you would be altogether silent! For you, that would be wisdom.
text_zh: 惟願你們全然不作聲，這就算為你們的智慧！

text: Like a gold ring in a pig's snout.
text_zh: 婦女美貌而無見識，如同金環在豬鼻上。

text: You are all worthless physicians.
text_zh: 你們都是無用的醫生。

text: Am I my brother's keeper?
text_zh: 我豈是看守我弟弟的嗎？

text: I wish they would go the whole way and emasculate themselves!
text_zh: 我甚至希望那攪亂你們的人把自己閹了！

text: Answer a fool according to his folly.
text_zh: 要照愚昧人的愚妄話回答他

text: Go tell that fox.
text_zh: 你們去告訴那隻狐狸

text: You are like whitewashed tombs, beautiful on the outside but full of dead men's bones.
text_zh: 好像粉飾的墳墓，外面好看，裏面卻裝滿了死人的骨頭

text: Maybe he is sleeping and must be awakened.
text_zh: 或是他睡著了，需叫醒他。

text: Better to live on a corner of the roof than share a house with a quarrelsome wife.
text_zh: 寧可住在房頂的角上，不在寬闊的房屋與爭吵的婦人同住

text: You brood of vipers! How can you speak good, when you are evil?
text_zh: 毒蛇的種類！你們既是惡人，怎能說出好話來呢？

text: Even a fool who keeps silent is considered wise.
text_zh: 愚昧人若靜默不言也可算為智慧。

text: Do you have eyes but fail to see, and ears but fail to hear?
text_zh: 你們有眼睛，看不見嗎？有耳朵，聽不見嗎？

text: You are doing the works of your own father.
text_zh: 你們是行你們父所行的事。

text: Where were you when I laid the earth's foundation? Tell me, if you understand.
text_zh: 我立大地根基的時候，你在哪裏呢？你若有聰明，只管說吧！

text: Surely you know, for you were already born! You have lived so many years!
text_zh: 你總知道，因為你早已生在世上，你日子的數目也多！

text: Will the one who contends with the Almighty correct him? Let him who accuses God answer him!
text_zh: 強辯的豈可與全能者爭論嗎？與神辯駁的可以回答這些吧！

text: I also could speak as you do, if you were in my place; I could join words together against you and shake my head at you.
text_zh: 我也能說你們那樣的話；你們若處在我的境遇，我也會聯絡言語攻擊你們，又能向你們搖頭。

text: So, because you are lukewarm—neither hot nor cold—I am about to spit you out of my mouth.
text_zh: 你既如溫水，也不冷也不熱，所以我必從我口中把你吐出去。

text: Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die.
text_zh: 讓我們吃吃喝喝吧！因為明天要死了。

text: Give strong drink to the one who is perishing, and wine to those in bitter distress.
text_zh: 濃酒當給將亡的人喝，清酒當給苦心的人喝。

text: Everything is meaningless.
text_zh: 虛空的虛空，虛空的虛空，凡事都是虛空。

text: I am a worm and not a man.
text_zh: 但我是蟲，不是人

text: Why then did you bring me out of the womb?
text_zh: 你為何使我出母胎呢？

text: Cursed be the day I was born!
text_zh: 願我出生的那一日受咒詛！

text: Every night I flood my bed with weeping.
text_zh: 我每夜流淚，把床榻漂起

text: Curse God and die!
text_zh: 你棄掉神，死了吧！

text: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind.
text_zh: 我被人忘記，如同死人，無人記念

text: Call me Mara, because the Almighty has made my life very bitter.
text_zh: 要叫我瑪拉，因為全能者使我受了大苦。

text: There is death in the pot!
text_zh: 神人哪，鍋裏有致死的毒物！

text: Happy is the one who seizes your infants and dashes them against the rocks.
text_zh: 拿你的嬰孩摔在磐石上的，那人便為有福！

text: The earth opened its mouth and swallowed them.
text_zh: 地裂開口，把他們...都吞下去。

text: Put a knife to your throat if you are given to gluttony.
text_zh: 你若是貪食的，就當拿刀放在喉嚨上。

text: She drove the peg through his temple into the ground, and he died.
text_zh: 把橛子從他鬢邊釘進去，釘入地裏...他就死了。

text: They will eat the flesh of their own sons and daughters.
text_zh: 我必使他們吃兒子的肉和女兒的肉

text: Then the fat closed in over the blade.
text_zh: 肥肉夾住刀刃

text: Dogs shall eat Jezebel within the bounds of Jezreel.
text_zh: 在耶斯列的田間，狗必吃耶洗別的肉

text: Throw her down!
text_zh: 把她扔下來！

text: I will execute great vengeance on them with wrathful rebukes.
text_zh: 我必向他們大施報應，發怒懲辦他們

text: Break the teeth in their mouths, O God.
text_zh: 神啊，求你敲碎他們口中的牙齒

text: If your right eye causes you to stumble, gouge it out and throw it away.
text_zh: 若是你的右眼叫你跌倒，就剜出來丟掉。

text: Do not suppose that I have come to bring peace to the earth. I did not come to bring peace, but a sword.
text_zh: 你們不要想我來是叫地上太平；我來並不是叫地上太平，乃是叫地上動刀兵。

text: Let the dead bury their own dead.
text_zh: 任憑死人埋葬他們的死人。

text: The dead know nothing; they have no further reward.
text_zh: 死了的人毫無所知，也不再得賞賜。

text: Then I hated all my labor in which I had toiled under the sun.
text_zh: 我恨惡一切的勞碌，就是我在日光之下的勞碌。

text: What has been will be again; there is nothing new under the sun.
text_zh: 已有的事後必再有；已行的事後必再行。日光之下並無新事。

text: For with much wisdom comes much sorrow; the more knowledge, the more grief.
text_zh: 因為多有智慧，就多有愁煩；加增知識的，就加增憂傷。

text: Woe to you who long for the day of the Lord! That day will be darkness, not light.
text_zh: 想望耶和華日子來到的有禍了！那日黑暗沒有光明。

text: Skin for skin! A man will give all he has for his own life.
text_zh: 人以皮代皮，情願捨去一切所有的，保全性命。

text: I looked, and behold, a pale horse! And its rider's name was Death.
text_zh: 我就觀看，見有一匹灰色馬；騎在馬上的，名字叫作死。

text: May his children be fatherless and his wife a widow.
text_zh: 願他的兒女為孤兒，他的妻子為寡婦。

text: Whoever strikes his father or his mother shall be put to death.
text_zh: 打父母的，必要把他治死。

text: I loathe my very life; therefore I will give free rein to my complaint.
text_zh: 我厭惡我的性命，要自由發出我的怨言。

text: I have become a laughingstock to all peoples, the object of their taunts all day long.
text_zh: 我成了眾民的笑話，他們終日以我為歌曲。

text: Your teeth are like a flock of sheep just shorn.
text_zh: 你的牙齒如新剪毛的一群母羊

text: I have become a brother of jackals, a companion of owls.
text_zh: 我與野狗為弟兄，與鴕鳥為同伴。

text: She lusted after her lovers, whose genitals were like those of donkeys.
text_zh: 她貪戀情人，因他們的下體如驢的下體

text: The Lord opened the donkey's mouth.
text_zh: 耶和華開了驢的口

text: Saul went in to relieve himself.
text_zh: 掃羅進去大解。

text: Your nose is like the tower of Lebanon.
text_zh: 你的鼻子彷彿朝大馬士革的黎巴嫩塔。

text: Cook it in the sight of the people using human excrement for fuel.
text_zh: 用人糞在眾人眼前烤餅。

text: I will strip naked and go barefoot.
text_zh: 赤身露體而行

text: David took their foreskins and presented the full number to the king.
text_zh: 大衛把他們的陽皮帶來，滿數交給王

text: He was eaten by worms and died.
text_zh: 他被蟲咬，就斷了氣

text: He left the linen cloth behind and ran away naked.
text_zh: 他卻丟了麻布，赤身逃走了。

text: Comfort me with apples, for I am sick of love.
text_zh: 用蘋果復甦我心，因我思愛成病。

text: I escaped only by the skin of my teeth.
text_zh: 我只剩牙皮逃脫了。

text: My days are swifter than a weaver's shuttle.
text_zh: 我的日子比梭更快，都消耗在無指望之中。

text: All our righteous acts are like filthy rags.
text_zh: 我們所有的義氣都像污穢的衣服

text: Then two bears came out of the woods and mauled forty-two of the boys.
text_zh: 於是有兩隻母熊從林中出來，撕裂了他們中間四十二個童子。

text: A living dog is better than a dead lion.
text_zh: 活著的狗比死了的獅子強。

text: Can you pull in Leviathan with a fishhook?
text_zh: 你能用魚鉤釣上鱷魚嗎？

text: Caught three hundred foxes and tied them tail to tail.
text_zh: 去捉了三百隻狐狸...將狐狸尾巴一對一對地捆上。

text: The Lord provided a huge fish to swallow Jonah.
text_zh: 耶和華安排一條大魚吞了約拿

text: Beware of dogs!
text_zh: 要防備犬類

text: As for the donkey, he breathed his last.
text_zh: 他被埋葬，好像埋驢一樣

text: No one whose testicles are crushed or whose male organ is cut off shall enter the assembly of the Lord.
text_zh: 凡外腎受傷的，或被閹割的，不可入耶和華的會。

text: Your navel is a rounded goblet that never lacks blended wine.
text_zh: 你的肚臍如圓杯，不缺調和的酒。

text: I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses.
text_zh: 我的佳偶，我將你比作法老車上套的駿馬。

text: Samson found a fresh jawbone of a donkey, and he struck 1,000 men with it.
text_zh: 他見一塊未乾的驢腮骨，就伸手拾起來，用以擊殺一千人。

text: On her forehead was written: MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF PROSTITUTES.
text_zh: 在她額上有一個名號寫著說：奧祕哉！大巴比倫，作世上的淫婦和一切可憎之物的母。

text: If two men are fighting and the wife of one of them grabs the other by the private parts, you shall cut off her hand.
text_zh: 若兩個人彼此爭鬥，一個人的妻近前來要救她丈夫脫離打他丈夫的人的手，抓住那人的下體，就要砍斷婦人的手。

text: If an ox gores a man or woman to death, the ox shall be stoned.
text_zh: 牛若觸死男人或是女人，總要用石頭打死那牛。

text: She made him sleep on her knees, and called for a man and had him shave off the seven locks of his head.
text_zh: 大利拉使參孫枕著她的膝睡覺，叫了一個人來剃除他頭上的七條髮綹。

text: So the sun stood still, and the moon stopped, till the nation avenged itself on its enemies.
text_zh: 於是日頭停留，月亮止住，直等國民向敵人報仇。

text: As a dog returns to its vomit, so fools repeat their folly.
text_zh: 愚昧人行愚妄事，行了又行，就如狗轉過來吃牠所吐的。

text: I will spread on your faces the offal from your festival sacrifices.
text_zh: 我要把你們節期祭牲的糞抹在你們臉上

text: He sent swarms of flies among them, which devoured them.
text_zh: 他叫蒼蠅成群來到他們中間，嚼盡他們。

text: The Lord sent fiery serpents among the people, and they bit the people.
text_zh: 於是耶和華使火蛇進入百姓中間，蛇就咬他們。

text: For a man against his father, and a daughter against her mother.
text_zh: 因為我來是叫人與父親生疏，女兒與母親生疏。

text: Whoever falls on that stone will be broken to pieces; but on whom it falls, it will grind him to powder.
text_zh: 凡掉在那石頭上的，必要跌碎；那石頭掉在誰的身上，就要把誰砸得稀爛。

text: If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son... all the men of his town are to stone him to death.
text_zh: 人若有頑梗悖逆的兒子...本城的眾人就要用石頭將他打死。

text: It is better to go to a house of mourning than to go to a house of feasting.
text_zh: 往遭喪的家去，強如往宴樂的家去。

text: He sits alone in silence, for the Lord has laid it on him. He buries his face in the dust — there may yet be hope.
text_zh: 他當獨坐無言，因為這是主加在他身上的。他當口貼塵埃，或者可以有指望。

text: My eyes grow dim with grief; my whole frame is but a shadow.
text_zh: 我的眼睛因憂愁昏花；我的百體好像影兒。

text: And he went up from thence unto Bethel: and as he was going up by the way, there came forth little children out of the city, and mocked him.
text_zh: 以利沙從那裏上伯特利去，正上去的時候，有些少年人出來戲笑他。

text: I said to myself, 'Come now, I will test you with pleasure to find out what is good.' But that also proved to be meaningless.
text_zh: 我心裏說：「來吧，我以喜樂試試你，你好享福！」誰知，這也是虛空。

text: Have you ever given orders to the morning, or shown the dawn its place?
text_zh: 你有生以來曾命定晨光，使清晨的日光知道本位嗎？

text: Is it by your understanding that the hawk soars and spreads its wings toward the south?
text_zh: 鷹雀飛翔，展開翅膀一直向南，豈是藉你的智慧嗎？

text: Now Lot went up out of Zoar and lived in a cave with his two daughters.
text_zh: 羅得帶著兩個女兒從瑣珥上去，住在山洞裏。

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, 'Make a snake and put it up on a pole.'
text_zh: 耶和華對摩西說：「你製造一條火蛇，掛在杆子上。」

text: She gave him a drink of milk, and then drove a tent peg through his skull.
text_zh: 她給他奶子喝，然後把帳棚的橛子從他鬢邊釘進去。

text: And the Lord was with Judah; and he drove out the inhabitants of the mountain; but could not drive out the inhabitants of the valley, because they had chariots of iron.
text_zh: 耶和華與猶大同在，猶大就趕出山地的居民，只是不能趕出平原的居民，因為他們有鐵車。

text: Their infants will be dashed to pieces before their eyes.
text_zh: 他們的嬰孩必在他們眼前摔碎。

text: And he said unto them, 'Whosoever hath sinned against me, him will I blot out of my book.'
text_zh: 耶和華對摩西說：「誰得罪我，我就從我的冊上塗抹誰的名。」
